AAF.caption: Element to be picked
AAF.doc: The ID of the element to be picked and that will float relative to another. If you are building a tooltip or context menu this element is the tooltip or context menu.
AAF.name: element_to_be_picked

AAG.caption: Anchor element
AAG.doc: The ID of the element that will serve as reference. This one is the anchor. The element that will stay in place while the other one comes to this one.
AAG.name: element_to_serve_as_anchor

AAK.caption: Strategy
AAK.doc: Options: "absolute" and "fixed". Use fixed in case the reference/anchor element is fixed too and the "absolute" option doesn't works.
AAK.name: strategy

AAc.caption: When you specify an offset, it affects the positioning of the child element relative to its reference element. The offset can be positive or negative, and it applies in the direction of the placement.
AAc.name: offset_info

AAd.caption: Top/Bottom placement: Skidding - moves element right/left, Displacement- moves element up/down depending if the values are positive or negative.
AAd.name: offset_info1

AAe.caption: Left/Right placement - Skidding- moves element up/down, Displacement- moves element right/left depending if the values are positive or negative.
AAe.name: offset_info2

AAf.caption: For a better understanding please inform yourself on Offset CSS property and how does it works depending on the relative element positioning.
AAf.name: offset_general
